intro: Lightfootia collomioides subsp. katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga lightfootia, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
